alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 3:58PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...PERIODS OF STRONG GUSTY WINDS POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON INTO TUESDAY MORNING... A strong cold front will move across the region and into the plains today. South winds this morning will shift into the west later today into tonight through early Tuesday morning with brief gusts around 55 to 60 MPH possible, especially between mile markers 240 and 280 west of Laramie and 320 to 345 for the I-80 Summit along Interstate 80. For Interstate 25, mile markers 70 and 75 near Bordeaux. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight or high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. Motorists are urged to use caution traveling across southeast Wyoming Monday afternoon and Monday night.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
